sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you think a <radical>tree</radical> looks <radical>sweet</radical> you have to be <kanji>certain</kanji> before you bite into it. Trees are really hard, and usually pretty bitter (believe me) so if you don't want a mouthful of broken teeth, sap, and sadness, you really need to be sure it's the one before you start munching.
meaningInfo: Which tree do you think is sweet? That one? Or that one? Are you absolutely certain? I hope you are!
readingMnemonic: If you really want to be <kanji>certain</kanji>, and not just guess, take out your <reading>bow</reading>ling (<ja>ぼう</ja>) ball and roll it as hard as you can into the tree. If its the right one it will let out a sweet smell, if it's not the tree will punch you.
readingInfo: So now let me ask you again, are you certain, or would you like to try the bowling ball test?
